pages.text: There exist several objects capable of absorbing vast amounts of magical energy, hence suitable as bases for infusion using the altar. They are called foci, and this category includes, among other items, a cloth poppet, a carved wooden figure, and a $(l:components/dry_wood)dried branch of a tree$().

pages.title: Poppet
pages.text: The rag poppet is a prevalent focus among sorcerers and witches. The magic of poppets is a separate branch in the art of witchcraft, yet this is far from all. With this focus, infusion can grant one a chance at a second life.

pages.title: Wooden Figurine
pages.text: Carved from wood, the figurine, owing to the susceptibility of plant materials to magic and heightened resonance, serves as an excellent focus. Such figurines are often used to create various idols and statuettes, channeling magical energy for the benefit of the homes where they are placed.

pages.title: Foci
pages.text: These foci are what absorb the magic of the surrounding space on the altar. Though they bear some similarities, the artifacts resulting from their infusion can have entirely different purposes. This section, along with the artifacts section, describes some of these magical items.
